definition[0]: a company that prepares goods to be sent somewhere by wrapping or packing them
example[0]: In November, the company acquired Jimboâ€™s Jumbos Inc., a processor and packager of peanuts.
example[1]: Manufacturers and packagers have arranged to pick up transport wrappings from retailers for recycling.
definition[1]: a company that puts together products, information, or other services and prepares them so they can be sold together
example[2]: Credit-card issuers are major packagers of financial information, often telling merchants how much customers spend in their stores, and how often they shop there.
definition[2]: a financial institution that puts together and sells investments offered by other companies and financial institutions
example[4]: John Nuveen & Co. is one of the largest packagers of tax-exempt unit investment trusts.
definition[3]: a financial institution that packages loans it has bought from lenders and sells them as bonds
